July 14, 1961
Mr. Elmer Sulzer, Director
Kadio and Television Goimaunications
Department of Eadio and Television
Indiana University
Bloomington, Indiana
Dear Bromo*
I suarted a letter to you June 16, which was
interrupted by my assignment to write the P.E. article
for EABB’s special magazine, and now that I have
finished the article, I’m sending you a copy, and
will at last forward some of my thinking on BAEB’s
P.it. Committee, as I promised.
You’ll notice from my article that I quoted
from your "Manual." I think you did a beautiful
job on it. It is not only attractive, but contains
a lot of good material, as well. Betty McKenzie
sent it along with her letter asking me to write
the article.
You may have wondered why I indicated in my
May 25 letter that I don't feel a full-time jublic
elation© Director is essential for the MEB. I
feel one of the main functions of the DALB resident
is rublic relations...He is the official represent-
ative of the organization at meetings, as a speaker,
and at social functions. If the staff becomes too
large at the national headquarters level, the cues
must continue to be raised — and belonging to the
national or anization then becomes a hardship to
members. (However, if the organization ever feels
it can gif ford an official P.E. representative, I’d
like the job! It’s quite possible that the National
Coffers are bulging much more than I am aware!)
I believe a well organized public relations
committee could accomplish a great deal toward en¬
hancing the national image of BAEB. And this is
a time when an intensified public relations cam-
paign is sorely needed. Following are a few sug¬
gestions for a course of action which you might
like to consider:
